Business_AssetObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Business_AssetObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Business_AssetObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: A reference to the asset that should be reclassified

validation.validation: You can't reclassify removed assets, disposed assets, assets that have no posted depreciation, or assets that have been impaired.
validation.description: You can't reclassify removed assets, disposed assets, assets that have no posted depreciation, or assets that have been impaired.

validation.validation: The asset specified cannot currently be reclassified because it has other activities in progress.
validation.description: The asset specified cannot currently be reclassified because it has other activities in progress.

validation.validation: Discrete Composite Asset or Components of Non-Discrete Composite Asset cannot be reclassified.
The asset is part of a lease contract. You can't reclassify leased assets.
validation.description: The asset is part of a lease contract. You can't reclassify leased assets.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures the Comment for the Business Process.

Reclassify_Asset_Data.description: The transaction effective date for the asset reclassification

validation.validation: Enter a Transaction Effective Date in an existing Ledger Period.
The asset has an event with a transaction date after the reclassify transaction effective date.
Enter a Transaction Effective Date for the reclassification that isn't later than today.

The transaction effective date is prior to this asset's conversion into Workday. The portion of accumulated depreciation that represents depreciation taken in a prior system will not be included in the depreciation recalculation in Workday.
Enter a Transaction Effective Date isn't after the end date of the last period in the depreciation schedule when useful life is adjusted.
Enter a Transaction Effective Date that isn't before the last resume date when useful life is changed.
Enter a Transaction Depreciation Start Date that is after this asset's conversion into Workday when the useful life is changed.

validation.validation: The spend category of the item ([item]) must be Tracked and the item must relate to the spend category ([SpendCat]).
You must change the item, spend category, asset class, or asset type.
You can't reclassify an asset that you register from a supplier contract.

Asset_Useful_Life_for_Reclassify_Data.description: Reference to asset book of which you want to change useful life.
Reference to Useful Life for the specified book.

validation.validation: Enter a Useful Life that is more than the number of periods that the asset has depreciated as of the transaction effective date.

When depreciation is based on the number of days per period, all the fiscal years / periods for an asset's useful life must already be created in order to calculate the depreciation amount for each period correctly.   In order to complete the accounting setup for this asset, you will first need to create additional fiscal years / periods for the fiscal schedule of this asset's company.
Useful life must be greater than zero.

The useful life of [Asset] can't be changed in the [Book] book because it uses a term or declining balance depreciation method. You must set the proposed useful life to the original useful life of [Original Useful Life] periods.

The useful life of [Asset] can't be changed because the asset was added as fully depreciated in the [Book] book. You must set the proposed useful life to the original useful life of [Original Useful Life] periods.

Reclassify_Asset_Data.description: Reference data to enter useful life per asset book for reclassification

validation.validation: You can enter only one useful life per book.

description: Contains data used to process the asset reclassification

validation.validation: You must specify all, and only all, asset books in which the asset is depreciable.
